details.title: Artificial Site Shielding for Communications Satellite Earth Stations
details.abstract: A method of reducing the possibilities of interference between earth stations and microwave radio-relay stations by the use of pit shielding has been investigated. A pit was constructed containing a 32-foot diameter antenna. Measurements are reported which indicate a shielding advantage of at least 25 dB. A siting example under actual conditions is given.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
